title: Mike Tyson shows off incredible speed... after telling Conor McGregor 'to look inside himself'
text:
Boxing legend Mike Tyson gave a spontaneous tutorial to a fan, showing off his deft speed and movement at the age of 53, and has also given some words of advice to Conor McGregor.

Tyson, a former undisputed heavyweight champion of the world, was asked about posture and movement by a member of the public, and promptly gave a demonstration.

After taking off his jacket, he ducked, turned on his heels and showed off his still electric hand-speed before explaining his moves to the onlookers.

SCROLL DOWN FOR VIDEO

Mike Tyson shows he still has the lightning quick movement which made him a champion

The 53-year-old twists and turns whilst in normal clothes as the two men observe closely

Former boxing champion Tyson then uses one of the men to show why he moved in such a way

Mike Tyson still has the moves 🥊 pic.twitter.com/P2nplnWdp9 — Boxing Exposure (@Boxing_Exposure) October 16, 2019

Meanwhile Tyson, who was sentenced to six years in jail for rape back in 1992, has offered his opinion on the misdemeanours of Irish MMA star Conor McGregor.

McGregor is currently on bail after being accused of allegedly assaulting a man at a pub in Dublin in April.

The incident came after the Irish 31-year-old was banned for six months by the Nevada State Athletic Commission after the infamous bust-up which followed his loss to Khabib Nurmagomedov at UFC 229.

Both camps squared up to each other in a fight which spilled outside the Octagon and overshadowed the bout itself.

Conor McGregor has only fought once since his boxing debut against Floyd Mayweather

But now Tyson has offered some advice to McGregor, who has not fought since the loss to Khabib.

'Conor has to look inside himself and [say], "What happened? Why am I the way I am?",' Tyson told the Ariel Helwani MMA Show.

Tyson then mentioned he believes sportspeople mostly find themselves in trouble due to the money they earn and the effect it has.

McGregor is on bail until November 1 when he will either make a plea or contest the charge

'We don’t know how to handle this stuff. We got millions of dollars. We never had this. Our families never had this. We’ve never been around this life.

'All of a sudden you start fighting, doing something you love to do, and you do it easily and all of a sudden they give you a lot of money for doing it.

'You give it away. You buy people gifts that don’t deserve gifts. You just don’t know what to do with it. You feel you don’t deserve it.'
description: Tyson, who showed off his lightning quick hand speed and movement, said about McGrgeor: 'Conor has to look inside himself and [say], 'What happened? Why am I the way I am?'
